symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.pattern: May be absent (anicteric) in many cases

symptoms.name: Mucocutaneous lesions
symptoms.pattern: Present in less than half of cases

lab_values.transaminases: Elevated >10 times the upper limit of normal
lab_values.HSV DNA PCR: Positive in cases of HSV hepatitis
lab_values.HSV serology: May be positive, but less sensitive than PCR

risk_factors: Immunocompromised state (pregnancy, corticosteroid use, HIV, autoimmune disease)

imaging_findings.CT scan: May show hepatomegaly and diffuse hypodense 1-4 mm lesions (representing foci of acute hepatic necrosis)

supportive: Liver biopsy showing focal or confluent areas of acidophilic necrosis with little inflammation and Cowdry type A bodies
Clinical presentation consistent with acute hepatitis

differential_diagnoses: Other causes of acute hepatic failure (e.g., Hepatitis A, B, C, D, E, acetaminophen toxicity, ischemic liver injury)
